TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit StoryFragments extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1<class System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment>, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild

Docs.summary: Represents a set of one or more elements.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A StoryFragments element defines the structure and content of a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.FixedPage>.
StoryFragments is the root of one or more <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> elements.
For detailed information about the document structure of [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)], see Chapter 9 and Appendix E of the *XML Paper Specification (XPS)* that can be downloaded from the [Windows Hardware Developer Central](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=65761).
## Examples The following example shows how to use of the StoryFragments element in an [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xps](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)] document.
[!code-xml[DocumentStructure#DocStructStoryFrags1](~/add/codesnippet/xaml/DocumentStructure/Content/FixedPage1_structure.xaml#docstructstoryfrags1)]

Docs.summary: Adds a child object to the .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragments> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild> interface.
Only a <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragment> can be a child of <xref:System.Windows.Documents.DocumentStructures.StoryFragments> and there must be at least one child.
